arena.core

Class GameUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • arena.core.GameUtility

  • public final class GameUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameUtility class represents a toolkit of utility functions available to the user. Most are common methods to simplify the lives of developers. Contains methods that handle path-finding, line-of-sight checks, and finding nearest or futher of a certain entity, and much more. This is used in conjuction with GameState.
    Author:
    ERAU AI Club

    • Method Detail

      • isWalkable

        public final boolean isWalkable(int x,
                                int y)
                         throws OutOfBoundsException
        Returns true if the tile at the specified position is walkable by players and projectiles, false otherwise.

        The position is zero-based, meaning the the minimum coordinate is (0, 0) (top-left) and the maximum coordinate is (GameState.getMapWidth()-1, GameState.getMapHeight()-1) (bottom-right).

        Parameters:
        x - - a zero-based x-position
        y - - a zero-based y-position
        Returns:
        true if the tile at the specified position is walked, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        OutOfBoundsException - when the position is out of bounds

      • calculatePath

        public final Vector2[] calculatePath(int startX,
                                     int startY,
                                     int destinationX,
                                     int destinationY)
                              throws OutOfBoundsException
        Returns the path as an array of tile positions that are taken to reach the destination position. The path contains, in order, the tiles that it takes to reach the destination. The first element in the array is the first tile to visit and not the start tile.

        Calculates the shortest path from (startX, startY) to (destinationX, destinationY) using the A* path-finding algorithm. If no path is possible, returns an empty array.

        The positions are zero-based, meaning the the minimum coordinate is (0, 0) (top-left) and the maximum coordinate is (GameState.getMapWidth()-1, GameState.getMapHeight()-1) (bottom-right).

        Parameters:
        startX - - the start zero-based x-position
        startY - - the start zero-based y-position
        destinationX - - the destination zero-based x-position
        destinationY - - the destination zero-based y-position
        Returns:
        a series of vectors of the tiles in the path, from start to destination
        Throws:
        OutOfBoundsException - when either position is out of bounds

      • isReachable

        public final boolean isReachable(int startX,
                                 int startY,
                                 int destinationX,
                                 int destinationY)
                          throws OutOfBoundsException
        Returns true if the tile at the specified position is reachable via path-finding, false otherwise.

        The positions are zero-based, meaning the the minimum coordinate is (0, 0) (top-left) and the maximum coordinate is (GameState.getMapWidth()-1, GameState.getMapHeight()-1) (bottom-right).

        Parameters:
        startX - - the start zero-based x-position
        startY - - the start zero-based y-position
        destinationX - - the destination zero-based x-position
        destinationY - - the destination zero-based y-position
        Returns:
        true if the tile at the specified position is reachable, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        OutOfBoundsException - when either position is out of bounds

      • haveLineOfSight

        public final boolean haveLineOfSight(int startX,
                                     int startY,
                                     int destinationX,
                                     int destinationY)
                              throws OutOfBoundsException
        Returns true if the start tile has a line of sight towards the destination tile.

        Note: This method only handles tiles that are in the same row or same column. They need to share a common x-position or y-position.

        The positions are zero-based, meaning the the minimum coordinate is (0, 0) (top-left) and the maximum coordinate is (GameState.getMapWidth()-1, GameState.getMapHeight()-1) (bottom-right).

        Parameters:
        startX - - the start zero-based x-position
        startY - - the start zero-based y-position
        destinationX - - the destination zero-based x-position
        destinationY - - the destination zero-based y-position
        Returns:
        true if the start tile can see without obstacles the destination tile, false otherwise
        Throws:
        OutOfBoundsException - when either position is out of bounds

      • moveTowards

        public final Action moveTowards(int destinationX,
                                int destinationY)
                         throws OutOfBoundsException
        Returns an action that moves the player to the specified location; if there is no path, it will return Action.NoAction.

        This uses A* pathfinding to calculate the shortest path from calculatePath(int, int, int, int).

        The position is zero-based, meaning the the minimum coordinate is (0, 0) (top-left) and the maximum coordinate is (GameState.getMapWidth()-1, GameState.getMapHeight()-1) (bottom-right).

        Parameters:
        destinationX - - the destination zero-based x-position
        destinationY - - the destination zero-based y-position
        Returns:
        an action to move the player to the destination location.
        Throws:
        OutOfBoundsException - when the position is out of bounds

      • shootTowards

        public final Action shootTowards(int destinationX,
                                 int destinationY)
                          throws OutOfBoundsException
        Returns an action that shoots a projectile to the specified location.

        The position is zero-based, meaning the the minimum coordinate is (0, 0) (top-left) and the maximum coordinate is (GameState.getMapWidth()-1, GameState.getMapHeight()-1) (bottom-right).

        Note: The destination position must share either the x or the y position with the player. If this isn't true, the method will return Action.NoAction.

        Parameters:
        destinationX - - the destination zero-based x-position
        destinationY - - the destination zero-based y-position
        Returns:
        an action to shoot a projectile to the destination location.
        Throws:
        OutOfBoundsException - when the position is out of bounds

      • placeMineTowards

        public final Action placeMineTowards(int destinationX,
                                     int destinationY)
                              throws OutOfBoundsException
        Returns an action that places a mine towards the specified location. Will return Action.NoAction if the player cannot place a mine due to its cooldown.

        The position is zero-based, meaning the the minimum coordinate is (0, 0) (top-left) and the maximum coordinate is (GameState.getMapWidth()-1, GameState.getMapHeight()-1) (bottom-right).

        Note: The destination position must share either the x or the y position with the player. If this isn't true, the method will return Action.NoAction.

        Parameters:
        destinationX - - the destination zero-based x-position
        destinationY - - the destination zero-based y-position
        Returns:
        an action to place a mine towards the destination location.
        Throws:
        OutOfBoundsException - when the position is out of bounds

      • manhattanDistance

        public final int manhattanDistance(int startX,
                                   int startY,
                                   int destinationX,
                                   int destinationY)
        Calculates the manhattan distance between the specified locations. 
         Manhattan distance = dx + dy,
 
        where dx = absolute(destinationX - startX)
        and   dy = absolute(destinationY - startY)

        The positions are zero-based, meaning the the minimum coordinate is (0, 0) (top-left) and the maximum coordinate is (GameState.getMapWidth()-1, GameState.getMapHeight()-1) (bottom-right).

        Parameters:
        startX - - the start zero-based x-position
        startY - - the start zero-based y-position
        destinationX - - the destination zero-based x-position
        destinationY - - the destination zero-based y-position
        Returns:
        the manhattan distance between the specified locations

      • euclidianDistance

        public final double euclidianDistance(int startX,
                                      int startY,
                                      int destinationX,
                                      int destinationY)
        Calculates the euclidian distance between the specified locations. 
         Euclidian distance = sqrt(dx*dx + dy*dy),
 
        where dx = absolute(destinationX - startX)
        and   dy = absolute(destinationY - startY)

        The positions are zero-based, meaning the the minimum coordinate is (0, 0) (top-left) and the maximum coordinate is (GameState.getMapWidth()-1, GameState.getMapHeight()-1) (bottom-right).

        Parameters:
        startX - - the start zero-based x-position
        startY - - the start zero-based y-position
        destinationX - - the destination zero-based x-position
        destinationY - - the destination zero-based y-position
        Returns:
        the manhattan distance between the specified locations

      • findNearest

        public final Vector2 findNearest(int x,
                                 int y,
                                 GameState.EntityType criterion)
                          throws OutOfBoundsException
        Finds and returns the position of the nearest entity as specified by criterion. If no entities are found, returns null.

        The following code snippet finds the position of the nearest health pack: 

         // Assume have reference to gameUtility and gameState
 int playerX = gameState.getPlayerX();
 int playerX = gameState.getPlayerY();
 Vector2 nearestHealthPack = gameUtility.findNearest(playerX, playerY, EntityType.HealthPack);
 if(nearestHealthPack != null) // check if found a health pack
 {
   // do things such as moving towards it...
 }

        The position is zero-based, meaning the the minimum coordinate is (0, 0) (top-left) and the maximum coordinate is (GameState.getMapWidth()-1, GameState.getMapHeight()-1) (bottom-right).

        Parameters:
        x - - a zero-based x-position
        y - - a zero-based y-position
        criterion - - the entity type to search for
        Returns:
        the position of the nearest entity, null otherwise
        Throws:
        OutOfBoundsException - when the position is out of bounds

      • findFurthest

        public final Vector2 findFurthest(int x,
                                  int y,
                                  GameState.EntityType criterion)
                           throws OutOfBoundsException
        Finds and returns the position of the furthest entity as specified by criterion. If no entities are found, returns null.

        The following code snippet finds the position of the furthest health pack: 

         // Assume have reference to gameUtility and gameState
 int playerX = gameState.getPlayerX();
 int playerX = gameState.getPlayerY();
 Vector2 furthestHealthPack = gameUtility.findFurthest(playerX, playerY, EntityType.HealthPack);
 if(furthestHealthPack != null) // check if found a health pack
 {
   // do things such as moving towards it...
 }

        The position is zero-based, meaning the the minimum coordinate is (0, 0) (top-left) and the maximum coordinate is (GameState.getMapWidth()-1, GameState.getMapHeight()-1) (bottom-right).

        Parameters:
        x - - a zero-based x-position
        y - - a zero-based y-position
        criterion - - the entity type to search for
        Returns:
        the position of the furthest entity, null otherwise
        Throws:
        OutOfBoundsException - when the position is out of bounds

      • isWithinStorm

        public final boolean isWithinStorm(int x,
                                   int y,
                                   int stormSize)
                            throws OutOfBoundsException
        Checks if the specified position is within the storm, given a storm size.

        The current storm size can be retrieved by GameState.getStormSize() and the maximum storm size by GameState.getStormMaxSize(). The size of the storm is the amount of diagonal blocks from the map's edges.

        The position is zero-based, meaning the the minimum coordinate is (0, 0) (top-left) and the maximum coordinate is (GameState.getMapWidth()-1, GameState.getMapHeight()-1) (bottom-right).

        Parameters:
        x - - a zero-based x-position
        y - - a zero-based y-position
        stormSize - - the size of the storm
        Returns:
        true if the position is within the storm radius, false otherwise
        Throws:
        OutOfBoundsException - when the position is out of bounds

      • chooseRandomly

        public final Action chooseRandomly(Action... actions)
        Chooses randomly from the specified actions. If no actions are specified, Action.NoAction is returned.

        For example, the following snippet will randomly choose a move action: 

         Action randomMove = chooseRandomly(Action.MoveUp, Action.MoveDown, Action.MoveLeft, Action.MoveRight);
        Parameters:
        actions - - the set of actions to randomly choose from
        Returns:
        a random action from the specified actions
